intro: Hieracium humifusum, commonly known as the creeping hawkweed, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically forms dense mats on the ground, with hairy stems and yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while its roots are fibrous and spread horizontally. Hieracium humifusum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in meadows, woodland edges, and along roadsides.
